intro: Campanula korabensis, commonly known as the Korab bellflower, is a perennial herb native to the Balkan Peninsula. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue to violet flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or mountainous habitats, preferring well-drained soils. It has lance-shaped leaves and produces clusters of flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
